goal.tools.mc.program.goal

Class GOALProg<T extends Term,A extends Atom,U extends Update>

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.tools.mc.program.goal.GOALProg<T,A,U>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Automaton, Program
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GOALPrologProg

    public abstract class GOALProg<T extends Term,A extends Atom,U extends Update>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Program
    Represents a program component for a single-agent GOAL system in the absence of an environment.
    Author:
    sungshik

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GOALProg(java.lang.String path, Formula f, Controller cont, boolean por)
      Constructs a GOALProg object according to the agent file at the specified path, given the formula under investigation, the controller that invokes this constructor, and a flag indicating whether partial order reduction should be applied.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GOALProg

        public GOALProg(java.lang.String path,
        Formula f,
        Controller cont,
        boolean por)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        Constructs a GOALProg object according to the agent file at the specified path, given the formula under investigation, the controller that invokes this constructor, and a flag indicating whether partial order reduction should be applied.
        Parameters:
        path - - The path at which the agent file should be found.
        f - - The formula under investigation.
        cont - - The controller that controls the object to be created.
        por - - Flag indicating whether POR should be applied.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

        Parameters:
        program - - The program that the analyzer should analyze.
        voc - - The vocabulary of the property under investigation.

        public boolean checkPerceptRules()
        Checks whether the agent represented by this automaton contains percept rules.
        Returns:
        true if percept rules are present; false otherwise.

      • generate

        public void generate()
        Description copied from interface: Automaton
        Generates the entire state space of the automaton. Although implementations of this interface may decide how the automaton is represented and stored internally, it is assumed that some internal storage facility is present (otherwise, this method would not make much sense).
        Specified by:
        generate in interface Automaton

      • getPerformedAction

        public java.lang.String getPerformedAction(State state,
                                  State successorState)
        Description copied from interface: Program
        Gets the action (as a string of text) that need be performed to get from the specified state to its successor.
        Specified by:
        getPerformedAction in interface Program
        Parameters:
        state - - The state in which the action to be determined need be performed.
        successorState - - The state that results from performing the action to be determined.
        Returns:
        A string representation of the action if the successor can be reached; null otherwise.
